summary: ok i agree that cyrus’ crush hasn’t been treated well but andi’s conflict is different because she knows jonah liked her and...
question: ok i agree that cyrus’ crush hasn’t been treated well but andi’s conflict is different because she knows jonah liked her and they had been dating. it’s not the same as a crush so i think we can’t really compare the two situations well
answer:
When Walker gets introduced, Andi and Jonah are not dating. At that point, Andi knows Jonah has maybe sorta kinda possibly liked her but doesn’t want to be her boyfriend. She had just told Jonah she’s over being so conflicted and wants to be free of the drama. And when Jonah does finally say he wants to be her bf, we get to see Andi feel conflicted about Jonah vs. Walker. She gets to express herself to both of them. And she would’ve had that opportunity regardless of Jonah’s reciprocity. So I think it still very valid to compare the two.

Even if Jonah doesn’t like Cyrus back, Cyrus is never allowed the opportunity to express how he feels in order to find out. Or even come out in general to Jonah to gauge his reaction. Cyrus commiserates with Andi in 2x13 about their Jonah conflict, and then it’s promptly tucked away again until he magically no longer has a crush.

LGBT children have equally as complex and valid feelings and crushes as straight children (if not more so complex tbh, because there’s often times that extra layer of acceptance they have to get to first). They can have feelings and crushes on multiple people just like straight children. And they can express those feelings to the person, regardless of the outcome.

But Cyrus gets so pigeonholed in a way that none of the (as far as we know) straight characters on the show do, and it’s sad.

While I think it’s stereotypical to have the one gay friend be the one to get rejected by their first crush, I would honestly take that if it meant Cyrus got to express himself and go through a real emotional arc, instead of just out of the blue being like “my crush is gone lol nbd”

summary: Marty, in the General Hospital, reminiscing about his party days: I used to throw one a month. People used to call them Marty...
body:
Marty, in the General Hospital, reminiscing about his party days: I used to throw one a month. People used to call them Marty Parties. People would call me up and say “Hey, Marty, when’s the next Marty Party?” “Isn’t it about time for another Marty Party?” “Sure had a great time at that last Marty Party!”

Buffy: Oh my god you need to stop

Marty: Or somebody might say, “Can I host the next Marty Party?”

blog.description: Tyrus Shipper. DJ Fruity Stan. AM Enthusiast.  i write fics and obsess over details, join me

summary: Tyrus is canon, now what? We need some plots!  Based on what we’ve seen of Cyrus’ life, we can safely assume his family has a...
body:
Tyrus is canon, now what?

We need some plots! 

Based on what we’ve seen of Cyrus’ life, we can safely assume his family has a good amount of money and are most likely upper middle class.

I think it would be a really interesting plot to see TJ from a lower economic background (Wow Kippen siblings works were too!):

  • TJ hesitating on inviting Cyrus to his house because he knows Cyrus’ house is much more fancy 
  • TJ feeling awkward b/c Cyrus’ parents take them to really nice restaurants and he knows he can’t return the favour
  • TJ having to do shifts at work during most of his spare time and feeling like Cyrus thinks he’s avoiding him
  • TJ not having the money to go out on mini golf dates and trampoline dates, but he always makes sure he can budget baby taters or a milkshake for Cyrus
  • Cyrus figuring it out and making sure TJ knows that none of that matters, Cyrus would prefer spending a whole day just sitting on the swings and talking to anything that costs money

I think it would be a pretty impactful plot and it’s definitely something I dealt with in middle school that I would love to see be represented on TV

blog.name: andimackshitposts
blog.title: I don't have enough money for baby taters
blog.description: Semi-hiatus. They call me Tater. I recently divorced the Andi Mack canon, and remarried jyrus headcanon land where they did more with Jonah's anxiety, Marty never left the party, and jyrus is canon and also endgame.  Icon by cyrus-gayman.

summary: 30 Days of Jyrus, Day 17
title: 30 Days of Jyrus, Day 17
body:
Title: A Modest Promposal 

Summary: It’s hard when your boyfriend is still mostly closeted at school, especially when it’s prom season. (background wandi and muffy)

“So, you’ll make sure that Andi doesn’t get to The Spoon until I text you that everything is set up?” Walker asked, eyes wide. “This is important.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes. “Don’t worry. I got this. Your promposal is going to go off without a hitch.”

Walker grinned. “Great, thanks. You’re the best.”

Cyrus reciprocated Walker’s smile, “I know.” Walker continued to ramble about his promposal plans as they walked towards the cafeteria for lunch, but Cyrus tuned him out. He’d heard the whole thing several times already, but Walker was (needlessly) nervous. He wanted to do something big for Andi, as if she wouldn’t say yes no matter how he asked. She’d been talking about senior prom since the eight grade. She’d definitely appreciate the big ask from her perfect, thoughtful boyfriend, though, and Cyrus was probably going to be hearing about it until college.  

Not that Cyrus wasn’t happy for Andi, but it was a bittersweet situation. Cyrus desperately wished he could have a promposal like that. Sure, he and Jonah were probably going to go together, but Cyrus would bet all his leftover Hanukkah money from Grandma Goodman, that Jonah would tell people outside their friend group that it was “just as friends” and that he’d spend half the night dancing with random girls instead of Cyrus. He tried not to resent Jonah for it, he knew that it was hard for Jonah, that he hated the idea of people seeing him differently. He was out to his close friends and to his parents, but most of the school was completely unaware that Jonah Beck was bisexual, let alone that he had been dating Cyrus Goodman for the better part of a year.

Cyrus wanted to shout from the rooftops that Jonah was his boyfriend. He wanted the whole world to know that he was in love. But he understood Jonah’s fear, of course he did, so he never pressured to Jonah to come out more than he was comfortable with. But things like this hurt. Both out of his own slightly narcissistic desire for attention, and because he wished that Jonah was comfortable and secure enough to be himself.

Cyrus and Walker entered the cafeteria and found Buffy, Marty, and Andi at their usual table. Cyrus slid in between Buffy and Andi, and Walker sat on the other side of Andi.  

“Where’s Jonah?” Marty asked.

“I was gonna ask you the same thing,” Cyrus’s quirked an eyebrow. “Don’t you have class together before lunch?”

Marty cocked his head to the side. “He said he was going to meet you.”

Cyrus shrugged. “I must’ve missed him.” Sometimes Jonah’s anxiety got the better of him, and he needed to be alone for a bit during lunch, and often times he used Cyrus as an excuse to get away from people. He didn’t think much of it, until lunch was nearly over, and there was still no Jonah.

He didn’t want to worry anyone else, though, because he knew Jonah wouldn’t want that, but he couldn’t stop himself from sending a quick text: where r u?

The response nearly instantaneous. doing hw. don’t worry.

Cyrus sighed in relief, slid his phone back into his pocket, and tried to focus on Buffy talking about her last basketball game until lunch ended and students flooded the halls again. Cyrus made his way to his locker, to grab the books he needed for his last classes of the day. He was slightly rushed, because his history teacher was going to give him detention if he was late one more time.

As soon as he opened his locker, he completely forgot about his history teacher and the looming threat of detention. A cluster of Mylar balloons shaped like rainbows exploded out of his locker, along with glitter and sequins that sailed delicately to the floor. Cyrus was glued to his spot. His first thought was that it was some kind of terrible prank, as he felt the eyes of every student passing through the halls suddenly fall on him. But then he heard Jonah’s voice.

“Cyrus!” He called, and Cyrus turned to see Jonah holding a sign with rainbow block letters. PROM?

“I…” Cyrus choked out quietly.

“I don’t want to hide anymore, Cy.” Jonah shrugged. “And I know you always wanted a big ask…So, uh. Will you go to prom with me?”

“Yes! Of course!” Cyrus’s mind finally connected to his body, and he threw his arms around Jonah, who dropped the sign to hold his boyfriend. Cyrus pulled back and picked up the sign. “Oh no, we’re keeping this forever.”

Jonah rolled his eyes. “You’re ridiculous.”

“Says the guy who stuffed my locker with rainbow balloons,” Cyrus laughed.

Jonah crossed his arms. “It is my God-given bisexual right to be dramatic.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes. “Don’t worry. I got this. Your promposal is going to go off without a hitch.”

Walker grinned. “Great, thanks. You’re the best.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes. “Don’t worry. I got this. Your promposal is going to go off without a hitch.”

Walker grinned. “Great, thanks. You’re the best.”

[[MORE]]

Cyrus reciprocated Walker’s smile, “I know.” Walker continued to ramble about his promposal plans as they walked towards the cafeteria for lunch, but Cyrus tuned him out. He’d heard the whole thing several times already, but Walker was (needlessly) nervous. He wanted to do something big for Andi, as if she wouldn’t say yes no matter how he asked. She’d been talking about senior prom since the eight grade. She’d definitely appreciate the big ask from her perfect, thoughtful boyfriend, though, and Cyrus was probably going to be hearing about it until college.  

Not that Cyrus wasn’t happy for Andi, but it was a bittersweet situation. Cyrus desperately wished he could have a promposal like that. Sure, he and Jonah were probably going to go together, but Cyrus would bet all his leftover Hanukkah money from Grandma Goodman, that Jonah would tell people outside their friend group that it was “just as friends” and that he’d spend half the night dancing with random girls instead of Cyrus. He tried not to resent Jonah for it, he knew that it was hard for Jonah, that he hated the idea of people seeing him differently. He was out to his close friends and to his parents, but most of the school was completely unaware that Jonah Beck was bisexual, let alone that he had been dating Cyrus Goodman for the better part of a year.

Cyrus wanted to shout from the rooftops that Jonah was his boyfriend. He wanted the whole world to know that he was in love. But he understood Jonah’s fear, of course he did, so he never pressured to Jonah to come out more than he was comfortable with. But things like this hurt. Both out of his own slightly narcissistic desire for attention, and because he wished that Jonah was comfortable and secure enough to be himself.

Cyrus and Walker entered the cafeteria and found Buffy, Marty, and Andi at their usual table. Cyrus slid in between Buffy and Andi, and Walker sat on the other side of Andi.  

“Where’s Jonah?” Marty asked.

“I was gonna ask you the same thing,” Cyrus’s quirked an eyebrow. “Don’t you have class together before lunch?”

Marty cocked his head to the side. “He said he was going to meet you.”

Cyrus shrugged. “I must’ve missed him.” Sometimes Jonah’s anxiety got the better of him, and he needed to be alone for a bit during lunch, and often times he used Cyrus as an excuse to get away from people. He didn’t think much of it, until lunch was nearly over, and there was still no Jonah.

He didn’t want to worry anyone else, though, because he knew Jonah wouldn’t want that, but he couldn’t stop himself from sending a quick text: where r u?

The response nearly instantaneous. doing hw. don’t worry.

Cyrus sighed in relief, slid his phone back into his pocket, and tried to focus on Buffy talking about her last basketball game until lunch ended and students flooded the halls again. Cyrus made his way to his locker, to grab the books he needed for his last classes of the day. He was slightly rushed, because his history teacher was going to give him detention if he was late one more time.

As soon as he opened his locker, he completely forgot about his history teacher and the looming threat of detention. A cluster of Mylar balloons shaped like rainbows exploded out of his locker, along with glitter and sequins that sailed delicately to the floor. Cyrus was glued to his spot. His first thought was that it was some kind of terrible prank, as he felt the eyes of every student passing through the halls suddenly fall on him. But then he heard Jonah’s voice.

“Cyrus!” He called, and Cyrus turned to see Jonah holding a sign with rainbow block letters. PROM?

“I…” Cyrus choked out quietly.

“I don’t want to hide anymore, Cy.” Jonah shrugged. “And I know you always wanted a big ask…So, uh. Will you go to prom with me?”

“Yes! Of course!” Cyrus’s mind finally connected to his body, and he threw his arms around Jonah, who dropped the sign to hold his boyfriend. Cyrus pulled back and picked up the sign. “Oh no, we’re keeping this forever.”

Jonah rolled his eyes. “You’re ridiculous.”

“Says the guy who stuffed my locker with rainbow balloons,” Cyrus laughed.

Jonah crossed his arms. “It is my God-given bisexual right to be dramatic.”
